Description: Fragment of an open vessel (cup?) in translucent dark blue and opaque white cameo glass. The decoration, in white, shows the neck and body, to the waist, and most of the arms of a woman or man in three-quarter view to the right. The right arm is bent up across the body, and the left arm is held forwards, almost certainly also bent. (S)he wears a garment falling in vertical folds with buttoned elbow-length sleeves, finishing above the elbow. (S)he also wears a broad collar decorated with rosettes and edged with beads, and a broad bracelet with hatched design on the right wrist. (S)he may be making offerings to a deity, as with on 1999.8-3.1.
Bibliographic references: Tatton-Brown et al 2007 / Roman Cameo Glass (23)
Glass 2 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass, Volume 2 (751)
